newsitem.title: BULGARIA: Bulgaria's Stoyanov aims for EU, NATO ties.
newsitem.headline: Bulgaria's Stoyanov aims for EU, NATO ties.

text.p: Bulgarian opposition candidate Petar Stoyanov claimed victory in Sunday's presidential election and pledged to work to bring his country closer to the European Union and NATO.
"Political independence and economic stability come through integration into the European Union and the Atlantic Alliance," the 44-year-old lawyer told a news conference.
"This victory we dedicate to you," he told cheering supporters.

Stoyanov, candidate of the Union of Democratic Forces (UDF) was speaking after projections by independent polling agencies showed him romping home against his rival, Socialist Culture Minister Ivan Marazov.
The Bulgarian Association for Fair Elections and Civil Rights put the winning margin at 59.7 to 40.3 percent.
Preliminary official results are expected early on Monday with the full outcome due by Wednesday.
